image.altText: An Aboriginal woman signs a document while sitting on a park bench next to a man.

props.synopsis: A litigation funder will pocket one-sixth of a $180 million settlement in a historic Northern Territory stolen wages class action while the Aboriginal workers themselves will get "at least $10,000" each.

title.children: Judge critical of law firm behind $180m stolen wages class action

image.altText: Wiradjuri woman Tara Croker who launched startup Yaala Sparkling smiles at the camera while sitting indoors

props.synopsis: The Indigenous business sector is experiencing significant growth but challenges remain around access to capital, a lack of culturally safe support and entrenched racism.

title.children: Why a new wave of Indigenous businesses are failing to meet full potential

image.altText: Luke Tribe and his new dog Fosse

props.synopsis: Luke Tribe didn't feel ready to get another dog soon after saying goodbye to his best friend of 10 years. But that time did eventually come.

title.children: When is the right time to get a dog after losing one?

image.altText: Three women in black formal wear walk out of court, one in front holding folders and looking at camera

props.synopsis: Lawyers for the family of Kumanjayi Johnson, who died in Alice Springs while under public guardianship, tell an inquest his family felt left out of his care and weren't told he went missing on the night he disappeared.

title.children: Inquest into death of Aboriginal man in care hears of support gaps

image.altText: Fireworks erupt behind Oscar Piastri as he gets out of his car after winning the Saudi Arabian F1 grand prix.

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri becomes the first Australian to lead Formula 1 drivers' championship in 15 years, passing Max Verstappen on the first cornerÂ

title.children: 'He forced me off': Red Bull unhappy as penalty hands Piastri Saudi win

image.altText: Pete Hegseth addressing a meeting of allies.

props.synopsis: A month after sharing details of an attack on Houthi rebels in a signal chat group that included a magazine editor, US media outlets are reporting US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth also shared details about the mission with family members.

title.children: US defense secretary reportedly shared Yemen attack details with family

image.altText: a media scrum in front of a newly build house

props.synopsis: The policies of both parties designed to increase housing supply are fine â they're just nowhere near enough.

title.children: Tradie problem fuelling the housing crisis needs more than a quick fix

image.altText: Frank Carbone

props.synopsis: The vast majority of new arrivals in Australia end up in our capital cities. Experts and locals weigh in on how it's affecting our housing crisis.

title.children: The mayor of this Aussie suburb says it's 'full' as the migration debate heats up

image.altText: Composite image of Gout Gout and Lachlan Kennedy.

props.synopsis: Lachlan Kennedy misses the Stawell Gift final after finishing second in his semifinal, meaning he will not have a showdown with sprint rival Gout Gout. Follow live.

title.children: Kennedy misses Stawell Gift final and potential showdown with Gout

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Martin holds off Hale to win fourth semi

image.altText: Peter Dutton with Grange Chung at the Royal Easter Show. Candidate for Reid

props.synopsis: The Coalition says if it is wins government it will trial a national child sex offender disclosure scheme that would allow members of the public to request information from police about whether someone who interacts with their children is a convicted offender.

title.children: Coalition promises trial of child sex offender register

image.altText: Two people standing at polling booths casting a vote.

props.synopsis: Political polling has been around as long as democracy itself and its influence on the election cycle is undeniable, but insiders say itâs never been more challenging to get right.Â

title.children: Inside the influential industry forecasting a Labor victory

image.altText: A man in a maroon collared shirt is pictured seating

props.synopsis: At this yearâs federal election, the South Australian seat of Boothby is one of the stateâs two marginal seats. As part of the ABCâs âYour Sayâ campaign, we spoke to residents in the electorate about their biggest concerns.

title.children: Boothby is a relatively wealthy electorate, but voters still worry about the cost of living

image.altText: He has curly grey hair, stubble and wears a green and blue striped jumper.

props.synopsis: The Anangu built one of the nation's most remote communities after nuclear bombs were tested on their country. But they face profound challenges amid extreme weather and rising costs.

title.children: Faced with extremes, the Spinifex People are being pushed to the limit

image.altText: A woman crying

props.synopsis: One commander has been dismissed as a result of an investigation into the killing of 15 Palestinian paramedics and emergency workers, who were found in a shallow grave a month ago.

title.children: Israel says killing of Palestinian medics the result of 'poor night visibility'

image.altText: A dark blue logo with white text saying "cryptoloc".

props.synopsis:
A politically-connected cybersecurity business has been liquidated months after winning a lucrative Queensland government contract.

Â

title.children: Politically connected cybersecurity firm liquidated after winning contract

image.altText: An older gentleman wearing a blue long-sleeved shirt, navy vest and cap grins surrounded by varying shades of green foliage.

props.synopsis: It started when farmer Fred Perry's kids came home from school about 30 years ago, telling him he needed to take better care of the environment. Now, his small slice of a farming island is home to amazing birdlife.

title.children: 'I was a basher and a burner': How a farmer switched his outlook

image.altText: The pope speaking into a microphone

props.synopsis: The pope, who is still recovering from a near-fatal bout of double pneumonia, drew cheers and applause from the gathered crowds.

title.children: Pope Francis appears at Easter Sunday to deliver blessing as recovery continues

image.altText: Lachlan Galvin runs alongside Western Suburbs Magpies teammates before a NSW Cup rugby league game.

props.synopsis: Lachlan Galvin will play for Wests Magpies in the NSW Cup today, his first match since news broke of his planned departure from Wests Tigers. Follow live.

title.children: Galvin hits the field for first time amid contract and bullying saga

image.altText: Prince Andrew, in a black suit, looks to the side

props.synopsis: The appearance was notable given Prince Andrew was absent from the royals' Christmas church service following a scandal involving an alleged Chinese spy.

title.children: Prince Andrew makes rare appearance with King Charles at Easter service

props.synopsis: John King captured footage of a 100-metre-tall fire tornado only 50 metres from his back door. Fire analysts say the phenomenon is becoming more common as the climate changes.

title.children: CFA volunteers were ready for fire season, but not for a 100m fire tornado

image.altText: A woman wearing a nun's head piece standing and singing at a church service.

props.synopsis: Israel Police have been accused of turning Jerusalem's Old City into a "militarised zone" and blocking worshippers from praying over Easter, after violent scuffles broke out near one of Christianity's holiest sites.

title.children: Christians criticise Israeli police for actions in Jerusalem over Easter

image.altText: More than a thousand dolphins can be killed in annual hunts in Solomon Islands

props.synopsis: A video showing the slaughter of hundreds of dolphins in Solomon Islands has gone viral on social media, sparking heated debate in Solomon Islands and the broader Pacific about the ancient practice.

title.children: 'Dolphin hunt' continues on this island, as debate rages over ancient practice

image.altText: A young man with blond hair in a suit stands next to an older man with glasses.

props.synopsis: A how-to-vote-card released by the Greens on Sunday instructs voters to pencil in a federal candidate who last week formally removed himself from the race, opening the party to criticism the move is a cash grab.

title.children: Greens urge supporters to vote for dropped candidate

image.altText: woman sits on grave.

props.synopsis: A NSW council is working out whether it can afford to keep six cemeteries open to future interments, when it doesn't know where people are already buried at some of the sites.

title.children: Burials halted as council works out whether it can afford cemeteries

image.altText: Will Poulter holds a large machine gun in Warfare.

props.synopsis: Civil War director Alex Garland has teamed up with a veteran soldier to tell a hyper-realistic story set during the Iraq war. While it avoids cliches and blood-lust, it refuses to engage with the politics.Â

title.children: This is one of the most realistic depictions of modern war on film

image.altText: Audience members in a red-lit room with screen at front saying Byron underground film festival.

props.synopsis: As streaming sees more and more people forgoing traditional cinemas to watch content at home, micro-cinemas showing alternative and niche films are rising in popularity across the country. Â  Â

title.children: Micro-cinema subculture emerges as traditional audience streams at home

image.altText: Holger Rune crouches with a big trophy. BARCELONA is written on the tennis court in front of him. Confetti is behind him.

props.synopsis: Holger Rune channels Olympic champion and 24-time grand slam winner Novak Djokovic as he ends Carlos Alcaraz's clay-court dominance in Barcelona.

title.children: Rune asks 'What did Novak do?' as he ends Alcaraz's unbeaten run

image.altText: Putin crosses his chest while holding a red candle sanding next to the Moscow mayor crossing his forehead.

props.synopsis: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says Russia is making a pretence of a ceasefire to advance on Ukraine's front line.

title.children: Ukraine says Russia has ramped up attacks despite ceasefire

image.altText: A large black and white cruise ship with a tug on the water.

props.synopsis: A luxury cruise ship will stop in Wallaroo in 2027, carrying almost 500 passengers, renewing the town's hope of benefiting from the cruise industry.

title.children: Cruise ships to return to SA's Copper Coast after seven-year hiatus

image.altText: A young woman wearing right stares ahead with a sombre look.

props.synopsis: Lucy Savage has to drive 450 kilometres multiple times a month to access specialised care â a reality for many women living with endometriosis and chronic gynaecological conditions around the country.

title.children: The travel toll of living with endometriosis in regional Australia

image.altText: Port Adelaide player Aliir Aliir confronts a Sydney Swans fan who threw something at him during an AFL game.

props.synopsis: The Swans are trying to find out if the fan who through an object over the fence at Port Adelaide's Aliir Aliir during their AFL clash is a member.

title.children: AFL fan removed by police after throwing object at Aliir

image.altText: A burnt out car crashed into a restaurant

props.synopsis: Police say offenders drove a car into a Greek restaurant in Yarraville and set it alight before fleeing.

title.children: Police investigate suspicious fire at inner-west Melbourne restaurant

image.altText: three people standing together, holding large letters that spell 'hope'

props.synopsis: It's been 10 years since three people died in flash flooding that devastated Dungog. The town's artistic flair and commitment to preparedness have been crucial to its recovery and the remembering of those lost.

title.children: One word underpins how this town came through a super-storm tragedy

image.altText: Cartoon characters Bart, Marge, Homer, Lisa and baby Maggie

props.synopsis: More than 35 years on from its debut, The Simpsons has been extended, but US Census data shows the nature of a typical family life has vastly changed since the beloved show has been on-air.

title.children: Families once mirrored The Simpsons. Now they don't, but the show is still going
